intro: Cottea pappophoroides, commonly known as the pappophore cottea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
